io.werval.spi.dev

Interface DevShellSPI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DevShellSPIAdapter, DevShellSPIWrapper 

    public interface DevShellSPI
    Development Shell Service Provider Interface.

    Methods of this class are used as extension points by the Werval Runtime in Development Mode.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes  
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  DevShellSPI.SourceChangeListener
      Listener for source changes.
      static interface  DevShellSPI.SourceWatch
      Watch allowing to stop watching.
      static interface  DevShellSPI.SourceWatcher
      File watching abstraction.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods  Instance Methods  Abstract Methods

      URL[] applicationClassPath()
      Application Classpath.

      void rebuild()
      Rebuild the Application sources.
      URL[] runtimeClassPath()

      Stop.

    • Method Detail

      • applicationClassPath

        URL[] applicationClassPath()
        Application Classpath.

        Typically build output directories.

        Returns:
        Application Classpath elements

      • runtimeClassPath

        URL[] runtimeClassPath()
        Runtime Classpath.

        Typically application dependencies, including Werval.

        Returns:
        Runtime Classpath elements

      • sourceURL

        String sourceURL(String packageName,
                 String fileName,
                 int lineNumber)
        Build Application source file URL if it exists.
        Parameters:
        packageName - Package name
        fileName - File name
        lineNumber - Line number
        Returns:
        URL to the Application source file or null if not present.

      • isSourceChanged

        boolean isSourceChanged()
        Returns:
        Return true if source has changed since last call to rebuild(), false otherwise

      • rebuild

        void rebuild()
      throws DevShellRebuildException
        Rebuild the Application sources.
        Throws:
        DevShellRebuildException - if something goes wrong, HttpServer implementation should use its DevShellRebuildException.htmlErrorPage() methods to get the payload to present to the user browser.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stop.
